Name: Stephany
Description:
Stephany’s body was found lying on the floor half naked and with signs of strangulation and multiple lesions in the ears, head, chest, face and arms.

> A 33-year-old [trans woman] was found dead in central Embu das Artes. The [victim], known as Stephanie, was lying half-naked on the floor, wearing only thigh-length panties and a bra. She had apparent strangulation marks and several injuries to the ears, head, chest, face and arms. 
> 
> When the military police arrived at the scene Stephanie was already dead. The suspicion is that she was a victim of homophobia. She did programs at the Paraná gas station, located at Km 280 of Régis Bittencourt, along with other [trans women]. One witness said one of the parking lot staff - who lives in a house at the back of the property - had thrown a "party" which three other [trans women] also attended.
>
> The official named by the witnesses was described as a stranger and drug user. The property where he lives was locked with padlocks, so the parking lot manager came to the place with the keys and confirmed that the suspect is her employee. 
>
> When the parking gate opened, the military police found several bloodstains on the floor. There was a lot of blood inside the house, especially in the bedroom, where there were also used condoms, a bloodstained earring, a cocaine pin, a rope, a crowbar (which appeared to have been washed recently) and a cloth, with a lot of blood, wrapped in cord form. The house had been cleaned recently, as it was partially wet.
>
> The parking lot manager stated that the suspect's family lives in Guarujá, and that he has a girlfriend who visits him frequently. Some correspondence on Bruno's behalf was seized by the expert, along with the objects found in the room. The case is still under investigation by the civil police of the Embu das Artes Police Station.

Stephany was reportedly a director of an LGBT group named DIVERSITAS:

<iframe src="https://www.facebook.com/plugins/post.php?href=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.facebook.com%2Fwanderley.bressan.7%2Fposts%2F139208039587980&width=500" width="500" height="408" style="border:none;overflow:hidden" scrolling="no" frameborder="0" allowTransparency="true" allow="encrypted-media"></iframe>

> *I met Stephany weeks before that happened. She was an old friend of one of the directors of DIVERSITAS. The case is unfortunate and revolting. Stephany's memory stays in our hearts as an incentive to keep the fight alive. I hope this will provoke the reflection of the people and governments who do not find the LGBT movement necessary. I need to register my thanks, respect and admiration for the team of Portal O Taboanense, for the seriousness, sensitivity and competence in elaborating this subject respecting the gender identity of our dear Stephany. Long live the LGBT movement to spare the blood of our dead by intolerant and inhuman homophobia. STEPHANY PRESENT!*

TvT partner organization: Centro de Apoyo a las Identidades Trans www.otaboanense.com.br 13.03.2013

https://web.archive.org/web/20141120202100/http://www.otaboanense.com.br/noticia/9199/travesti-%C3%A9-brutalmente-assassinado-em-embu-das-artes/

https://www.facebook.com/wanderley.bressan.7/posts/139208039587980

Name: Dayana Amilcar Iglesias
TDoR list ref: tgeu/4-Mar-2013/N.N. & tdor.info/4-Mar-2013/Adán Amilcar Iglesias & tgeu/not reported/Dayana (Adán) Amilcar Iglesias
Description:
Dayana's body was found in undergrowth with 4 gunshot wounds to the head. She had been killed around 10 hours earlier.

> In a thicket at the edge of the second ring [road], a man wearing women's clothes was finished yesterday morning.
>
> The victim who was identified as [deadname] Iglesias (20), had been shot four times in the head and had been dead about ten hours.
>
> The finding occurred yesterday in the morning about 400 meters before the turnoff for the road to the village of El Carmen.
>
> The deceased wore pants, a black blouse, pink underwear and brown sandals.

TvT partner organization: Centro de Apoyo a las Identidades Trans homofobiamata.files.wordpress.com  06.03.2013 & Centro de Apoyo a las Identidades Trans latribuna.hn 08.03.2013

https://web.archive.org/web/20210514184816/https://www.laprensa.hn/csp/mediapool/sites/LaPrensa/Sucesos/Policiales/story.csp?cid=365977&sid=951&fid=98
Tweet:
Dayana Amilcar Iglesias was shot in San Pedro Sula, Cortés (Honduras) on 4 Mar 2013.

She was 20. #SayHerName #TransLivesMatter #TDoR

Name: Rafaela
Description:
Rafaela was stabbed seven times on the street in the early hours of Wednesday 6th March.

> A person was killed with seven stab wounds in the center of Gravataí (RS), metropolitan region of Porto Alegre, at dawn on Wednesday. According to the Military Brigade, the unidentified victim is a [trans woman]. 

The crime occurred around 2:30 pm on Ary Tubbs Street. According to BM, the region is a point of prostitution. There is no information about the perpetrator or the reason for the murder. 

TvT partner organization: Centro de Apoyo a las Identidades Trans noticias.terra.com.br  06.03.2013

Name: Seda
Description:
The trans person was heavily beaten four days ago in the district Meis in Istnabul. NGOs stated that in the Meis district complaints about extreme violence against trans people have been increased since October 2012 and that in the last three weeks many trans people reported that they have been attacked and received death threats.

TvT project: Gay Star News 10.03.2013

Name: Vanesa Zabala
Description:
Vanesa's body was found beaten, hanged and impaled at the entrance roundabout to the city of Reconquista.

Three men, a woman and two minors were detained by investigators. More than four years later, the trial of the accused began on 21st November 2017. On 20th December José Luis "Cocido" Petroni, Gustavo Daniel "Virulana" Vallejos, José Daniel "Chuky" Villasboas and Ana Virginia Abasto were sentenced to life imprisonment with immediate detention for the crime of murder with aggravating acts of treachery, cruelty and for the participation of minors.

TvT partner organization: Centro de Apoyo a las Identidades Trans sinmordaza.com 29.03.2013

Name: Luz Johana López ("La Gorda")
Description:
Luz Johana was shot in the head and her body dumped on a road. She also had bruises on other parts of her body.

> Friends of López, a 26-year-old sex worker, reported that her friend and leader got into a car with someone she apparently knew. The next thing they knew was that they found her dead on the old road that leads from Manizales to Arauca.
> 
> "The first thing they told us was that they had killed someone from the transgender community, but at last they clarified that they had killed Luz Johana" commented some sex workers in the sector, visibly distressed by the event, as la Gorda was considered a leader of this guild in the city.

Luz Johana was the leader of Comunidad de trabajadoras sexuales y de transgeneristas de la Galería, Manizales (the Community of sex workers and Transgenders of the Gallery, Manizales).

Her murder was not recorded in the official TDoR 2013 list.

http://umcentral.umanizales.edu.co/index.php/2017/11/23/luz-yohana-lopez-una-vida-por-la-defensa-de-las-trabajadoras-sexuales/
